Lesson 7: Numbers

Before we start

Before we begin flex and close your hand a few times and make sure your fingers are good to go

Remember, your wrist orientation and finger position are crucial in sign making

This lesson you will be learning the Numbers 1-10. After this lesson you will be given the
choice of a multiple choice quiz, the camera identification quiz or returning to the main menu

1

All numbers will have your palm facing your listener

Starting with number 1, close fingers 1, 3, 4, and 5 with 1 resting on top of 3

Lastly, point finger 2 straight upwards to complete the sign

2

Similar to number 1, 2 closes fingers 1, 4, and 5 with finger 1 resting on 4

Next make a V with fingers 2 and 3 to complete the sign

3

Following the pattern 3 had fingers 4 and 5 closed to start

Fingers 1, 2, and 3 will all protrude outward in their respective directions

4

The number 4 slightly changes the pattern

For 4 you will close only finger 1 into your hand

Fingers 2, 3, 4, and 5 will protrude upward

5

5 is quite self explanatory

ALL fingers will protrude outward with an open palm

6

Unlike 1-5, numbers 6-10 don't represent the number using the number of fingers

6 starts with fingers 1 and 5 closed and resting on one another

Lastly, fingers 2, 3, and 4 are protruding upwards

7

Number 7 starts with fingers 1 and 4 closed into the palm

Fingers 2, 3, and 5 then protrude upwards to finish the sign

8

Number 8 starts with fingers 1 and 3 closed into the palm

Fingers 2, 4, and 5 then protrude upwards to finish the sign

9

Number 9 starts with fingers 1 and 2 closed into the palm

Fingers 3, 4, and 5 then protrude upwards to finish the sign

10

10 is the only dynamic number in the first ten numbers

To sign 10 close fingers 2, 3, 4, and 5 and face the long flat part of your knuckles towards your listener

Then bring finger 1 upwards and rotate the hand lightly left and right
